text: What the human mind can comprehend and believe, it can achieve
author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

text: Strive not for success, but for the values ​​it provides​
author: Albert Einstein

text: I owe my success to never making excuses or accepting excuses from others
author: Florence Nightingale

text: In my career I've missed over 9000 shots, lost almost 300 games
author: Michael Jordan

text: The hardest thing is getting started, everything else depends on perseverance
author: Amelia Earhart

text: One must love life more than the meaning of life
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: Life is what happens to you while you make plans
author: John Lennon

text: Logic can take you from point A to point B, imagination can take you anywhere
author: Albert Einstein

text: In 20 years you'll be more disappointed with the things you didn't do than with the things you did
author: Mark Twain

text: It's always worth starting with something that sows doubt
author: Boris Strugatsky

text: Real responsibility is only personal
author: Fazil Iskander

text: A meaningless life is not worth living
author: Socrates

text: 80% success is showing up in the right place at the right time
author: Woody Allen

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life
author: Steve Jobs

text: Winning isn't everything, everything is a constant desire to win
author: Vince Lombardi, American football coach

text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life
author: Immanuel Kant

text: I don't have the word 'impossible' in my dictionary
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Freedom is worthless unless it includes the freedom to make mistakes
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Either you rule your day, or the day rules you
author: Jim Rohn, public speaker and business coach

text: If you think you can do something, you're right; if you think you can't do it, you're right too
author: Henry Ford

text: The two most important days in your life: the day you were born and the day you realized why
author: Mark Twain

text: Start doing everything you can do - and even what you can even dream of
author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

text: The best revenge is a huge success
author: Frank Sinatra

text: It's often said that motivation doesn't last long
author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman and marketing consultant

text: Weak people try their whole lives to be as good as others
author: Boris Akunin

text: It's all about thoughts
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing and be nothing
author: Aristotle

text: The person you are meant to be is only the person you choose to become
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet and philosopher

text: Walk confidently towards your dream
author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, naturalist
